unnormalised: Someone asked me what's worse, forgetting your PAN card or your college roll number? Honestly, it's like choosing between getting stuck in Bangalore traffic during peak hours and finding out your favorite chai stall is closed! Both are equally soul-crushing, especially when you need them the most. Imagine trying to file your taxes without your PAN (ABCDE1234F) - you’re basically declaring war on the Income Tax Dept. Good luck with that!
normalised: Someone asked me what is worse, forgetting your P-A-N card or your college roll number? Honestly, it is like choosing between getting stuck in Bangalore traffic during peak hours and finding out your favorite chai stall is closed! Both are equally soul-crushing, especially when you need them the most. Imagine trying to file your taxes without your P-A-N (A-B-C-D-E one two three four F) - you are basically declaring war on the Income Tax Department. Good luck with that!

unnormalised: But let’s be real, the sheer panic of forgetting your college roll number (e.g., 20BCE123) hits differently. Suddenly, you're back in that exam hall, sweating bullets, desperately trying to remember if it's 20BCE or 20BEC, and whether that last digit was a 7 or an 8. It’s a trauma that stays with you, even years after graduation. You start having nightmares about failing that thermodynamics exam.

unnormalised: And the real kicker? They both seem to vanish the *instant* you need them. Like when you're filling out that crucial job application and they want your "educational qualifications" and every. Single. Roll. Number. Ever. Then your mind draws a blank and you start questioning all your life choices. Was that B.Tech really worth it? Maybe I should've just become a full-time samosa maker...
